eftaios.network.rmi.server

Class ServerWithRemoteImplementation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • eftaios.network.rmi.server.ServerWithRemoteImplementation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ServerWithRemoteImplementation
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ServerInterface

      • getServerModel

        public ServerModel getServerModel()

      • readyToPlay

        public void readyToPlay()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote method invoked by the user when the connection has estabilished that checks if the total number of players has been reached. If yes, then wakes up the server thread.
        Specified by:
        readyToPlay in interface ServerInterface
        Parameters:
        nothing -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • addClient

        public PlayerConnectionData addClient(RemoteControllerInterface client)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote method invoked by the user when he wants to connect. adds a RemoteControllerInterface Client to the server and returns connection data to the connected client. If the client is the first to connect, let him receive the data with the currentPlayer, otherwise the next player in the array.
        Specified by:
        addClient in interface ServerInterface
        Parameters:
        RemoteControllerInterface - client that wants to connect: actually a stub of the RemoteController
        Returns:
        PlayerConnectionData
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • removeClient

        public void removeClient(RemoteControllerInterface client,
                Model clientModel)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote method invoked by the client when he disconnects. His stub is removed by the clients array, the model he sends gets the list of the players redone without him, the currentmodel is replaced by his, and his ID is added to the list of the disconnected
        Specified by:
        removeClient in interface ServerInterface
        Parameters:
        RemoteControllerInterface - client that disconnects, his model
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getServerName

        public java.lang.String getServerName()
        Method that gets the server name
        Parameters:
        nothing -
        Returns:
        String name of the server

      • updateModel

        public void updateModel(Model model)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote method invoked by the client when his turn has ended, and the model on the server must be overwritten. First, a checkup of the number of total players is done: if the currentPlayer is disconnected, gets a new currentPlayer. Then the server's model is overwritten, and is passed to everyone. Then the control is passed to the currentPlayer, but only if the match hasn't ended. If it is, the match ends.
        Specified by:
        updateModel in interface ServerInterface
        Parameters:
        Model - model
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the current thread.
        Parameters:
        Model - model
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

                     java.rmi.RemoteException
